title: Channel 4 postpones reality show Smuggled after 39 bodies found in Essex lorry
text:
A Channel 4 show encouraged eight participants to evade Border Control by any means necessary (Picture: Getty)

Channel 4 has postponed a new reality series Smuggled in light of 39 dead bodies being found in the back of a lorry in Essex.

The risqué show sees eight British citizens try and enter the UK from Europe by any means necessary and without using their passports or documentation.

In the challenge, they need to evade capture and make it back to a meeting point undetected by Border Authorities by any means necessary.

This includes using methods that traffickers use including hiding in ferries, getting into car boots or attempting to cross by boat.

However, following the tragedy today in which 38 adults and one teenager were found dead in a van that had travelled from Bulgaria to Essex, they have pulled it from its scheduled time slot.

It was originally scheduled for Monday and has been delayed, not cancelled.

A Channel 4 spokesperson said: ‘In light of the tragic events today, we have postponed the transmission of the series.’

The lorry pictured in the industrial estate in Essex where the bodies of 39 people were discovered (Picture: Sky News)

When the show was announced, Alf Lawrie, the head of factual entertainment at Channel 4, said the show had ‘purpose at its heart’.

He said: ‘Extreme, authentic and utterly timely, it is a standout experiment that we hope will inform the national conversation.’

Ed Kellie, Executive Producer and founder of production company ScreenDog, added: Our borders fuel fiery debate, but little is known about how secure they really are.

‘The best way to truly find out is to try to break through.’

A 25-year-old from Northern Ireland has been taken into custody on suspicion of murder following the grim discovery.

The truck is believed to have made its way to Essex via a ferry port from Ireland to Holyhead, North Wales.

Smuggled will air on Channel 4 at an unconfirmed later date.
